content.question: The mass spectrum of the element <math alttext="S b" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Sb</mtext></mrow></math> is most likely represented by which of the following?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a mass spectrum with one vertical line. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in a m u, and the numbers 118 through 125, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Relative Abundance. The line begins on the horizontal axis at 122 a m u, and extends to near the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph of a mass spectrum with two vertical lines. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in a m u, and the numbers 118 through 125, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Relative Abundance. The first line begins on the horizontal axis at 121 a m u, and extends to near the top of the vertical axis. The second line begins on the horizontal axis at 123 a m u, and the second line is approximately 80 percent of the height of the first line.

The figure presents a graph of a mass spectrum with three vertical lines. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in a m u, and the numbers 118 through 125, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Relative Abundance. The first line begins on the horizontal axis at 120 a m u. The second line begins on the horizontal axis at 123 a m u. The third line begins on the horizontal axis at 124 a m u. The first and second lines are the same height, and are approximately 50 percent of the height of the third line, which extends to near the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph of a mass spectrum with three vertical lines. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in a m u, and the numbers 118 through 125, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Relative Abundance. The first line begins on the horizontal axis at 120 a m u. The second line begins on the horizontal axis at 121 a m u. The third line begins on the horizontal axis at 124 a m u. The first and second lines are the same height, and are approximately 5 percent of the height of the third line, which extends to near the top of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a mass spectrum with two vertical lines. The horizontal axis is labeled Atomic Mass, in a m u, and the numbers 118 through 125, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled Relative Abundance. The first line begins on the horizontal axis at 121 a m u, and extends to near the top of the vertical axis. The second line begins on the horizontal axis at 123 a m u, and the second line is approximately 80 percent of the height of the first line.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
